info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 35.

(1, 1).clue: "The ballot is stronger than the bullet"

(2, 1).clue: No vampires in Gilroy, California, the world capital of this, as a local farm ships 60 million pounds of it each year

(3, 1).clue: Miss Scarlet & Professor Plum are suspects in this classic whodunit game

(4, 1).clue: Pilot somewhere over the Atlantic, May 20, 1927

(5, 1).clue: This Hugh Grant movie was based on the French film "Neuf mois"

(1, 2).clue: In his first address to Congress: "All I have I would have given gladly not to be standing here today"

(2, 2).clue: Austin, Minnesota, capital of this, has Hormel as its largest employer; Hormel makes 396 cans of it per minute

(3, 2).clue: This plump doll with a top knot got its name from a pet form of "Cupid"

(4, 2).clue: Pilot up above his brother & others, December 17, 1903 at 10:35 AM

(5, 2).clue: This hit song begins "Tumble out of bed and stumble to the kitchen, pour myself a cup of ambition"

(1, 3).clue: "Let us never negotiate out of fear, but let us never fear to negotiate"

(2, 3).clue: With Maker's Mark & Jim Beam in the area, no wonder Bardstown, Kentucky is this potent potable capital

(3, 3).clue: Because of an allergy alert, one ingredient of this soft modeling compound that's not a secret is wheat

(4, 3).clue: "Operation Overflight" is his account of his famous Cold War flight over the USSR

(1, 4).clue: "There is no Soviet domination of Eastern Europe"

(2, 4).clue: The "1-800 centers" capital, we thought this Neb. city might be the insurance capital (but that's Hartford, Conn.)

(3, 4).clue: When this brand was introduced in 1970, it was billed as the "first official indoor ball"

(4, 4).clue: Pilot who made an "unplanned" trip to Ireland & got a parade for his trouble on August 5, 1938

(5, 4).clue: Jeri Ryan joined the crew on "Star Trek: Voyager" as the Borg with this 3-word name

(1, 5).clue: "It must be a peace without victory... Only a peace between equals can last"

(2, 5).clue: Home to the Univ. of Okla. Sooners & the Nat'l Severe Storms Lab., it is the severe weather research capital

(3, 5).clue: At the 1939 World's Fair, the Sawyer family introduced this stereo slide scope that gives 3-D views

(4, 5).clue: American pilot on the ground & "Behind Enemy Lines" in Bosnia for 6 days in 1995

(5, 5).clue: Taken from the title of a J.D. Salinger work, it was the name of Lisa Loeb's backing band

(1, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports.)  Two stars in the Big Dipper's bowl are called pointer stars because the line drawn through them points to this

(2, 1).clue: On March 25, 2003 "a new day" dawned as she began a 3-year run at Las Vegas' Colosseum

(3, 1).clue: It's the period of pause between the acts of a theatrical or musical performance

(4, 1).clue: Hamlet tells him, "Thou incestuous, murderous, damned Dane... follow my mother"

(5, 1).clue: The 36th state, it has 2 U.S. Senators, 3 U.S. Representatives & 5 electoral votes

(6, 1).clue: This critter (& university mascot) is Wisconsin's state animal; can you dig it?

(1, 2).clue: A.C. Crommelin proved that 3 of these, seen in 1818, 1873 & 1928, were really 1 of these visiting 3 times

(5, 2).clue: About 2 million people visited this 984-foot tall landmark in its first year, 1889

(6, 2).clue: Once a fur-trading center, this "colorful" city is Wisconsin's oldest permanent settlement

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew points to a planetary symbol on a chalkboard.)  The seventh planet has a symbol that incorporates the first initial of this discoverer's last name

(2, 3).clue: (I'm Ashleigh Banfield.)  I'm a native of this capital of Manitoba whose name comes from the Cree Indian word for "muddy water"

(3, 3).clue: A formal document that expresses the goals & aims of a company or organization

(4, 3).clue: Demetrius & Chiron rape & mutilate Lavinia; this general, her dad, bakes them in a pie that he serves their mom

(5, 3).clue: Each wall of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial, created by her, is about 250 feet long & the 2 meet at an angle of 125°

(6, 3).clue: Pack up your motor home & head out to this lake, the largest one entirely within Wisconsin

(1, 4).clue: The radiant is the point from which these, such as the Lyrids, originate

(3, 4).clue: This Southern California city of 90,000 is found in Orange County

(5, 4).clue: Some people are born with a forked this, the fleshy thing hanging from the middle of the soft palate

(6, 4).clue: There's no escaping the fact that his father, Mayer Samuel Weiss, was Appleton, Wisc.'s first rabbi

(1, 5).clue: 9-letter word for the phenomenon that produced the mass of stellar debris called Cassiopeia A

(2, 5).clue: In 1981 this "domineering" New York Islander became the second NHLer to score 50 goals in 50 games

(4, 5).clue: This title warrior, once a hero, is exiled from Rome & joins the enemy Volscians, who incite a mob to murder him

(5, 5).clue: "Glengarry Glen Ross" won him the bleepin' 1984 Pulitzer Prize for bleepin' drama

(0, 0).clue: "If I were to dress as a woman, they would think of me as a woman... What would become of me?" is a line from this 1923 play
